newsitem.title: QATAR: Qatar signs oil, gas deals with ARCO.
newsitem.headline: Qatar signs oil, gas deals with ARCO.

text.p: Qatar on Wednesday signed two oil and gas agreements with a consortium led by Atlantic Richfield Company (ARCO) of the United States.
The first agreement is a 25-year exploration and production sharing contract for marine block 11, located northeast of the Qatari mainland.
The second accord allows the consortium to develop and produce natural gas from a part of the mammoth North Field -- the world's largest single concentration of gas -- and market it in the Gulf.

"The agreements represent a new era of exploration and production of oil and gas in our country," Qatari Minister of Energy and Industry Abdullah bin Hamad al-Attiyah told reporters after the signing.

Other members of the consortium are Gulfstream Resources Ltd of Cyprus -- a subsidiary of Gulfstream Resources Canada Ltd, British Gas Plc's British Gas Exploration and Production Ltd, and the German firms Wintershall AG -- a subsidiary of BASF AG -- and Preussag Energie GmbH.
Qatar aims to boost oil production capacity to over 900,000 barrels per day bpd) and gas sales to around 25 million tonnes a year by the year 2000.

Under the exploration and production sharing agreement, the consortium will be required to conduct a new 2-dimensional (2-D) seismic and gravity survey over a minimum of 2,000 sq km and reprocess the existing 2-D seismic data of at least 500 sq km.
The consortium will also conduct a comprehensive multidisciplinary geological study and drill a minimum of two exploration wells during the first four years of the contract period.
Under the second agreement, the consortium will produce and market gas in the Gulf region in return for a share in the gas output. Condensates and other liquids will be marketed separately.
The already operates Qatar's offshore Al-Rayyan field which currently produces 32,000 bpd of crude oil.
